itemDescription: (1925-2012); British politician; elder brother of Katharine, Duchess of Kent

wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Marcus John Worsley, 5th Baronet,  (6 April 1925 – 18 December 2012) was a British Conservative Party politician. He served as a Member of Parliament in four parliaments between 1959 and 1974, and served as High Sheriff and Lord Lieutenant for North Yorkshire.

response: *1987–1999: Sir Marcus Worsley, with a lieutenant:

Shortly after he lost his parliamentary seat in 1974, Time magazine picked Nicholas Scott as one of its 150 "future world leaders". However in October 1974 Marcus Worsley, the MP for the safe Conservative seat of Chelsea, decided to retire. Scott was selected as the new Conservative candidate, and at the October 1974 general election, he was returned with over 60% of the vote. He immediately took a seat on the opposition front bench as Edward Heath appointed him spokesman on housing.
* Hon. Bridget Assheton (born 20 August 1926, died 22 May 2004).  Married Sir Marcus Worsley, Bt, brother of Katharine, Duchess of Kent

link_mentions.page: List of University of Oxford people in British public life

response: *Sir Marcus Worsley, 5th Baronet; MP for Keighley (1959–1964) and Chelsea (1966–1974)

Giles Arthington Worsley  (22 March 1961 – 17 January 2006) was an English architectural historian, author, editor, journalist and critic, specialising in British country houses. He was the second son of Sir Marcus Worsley of Hovingham Hall, a nephew of Katharine, Duchess of Kent, and died of cancer aged 44.
**Sir Marcus Worsley, 87, politician, MP for Keighley (1959–1964) and Chelsea (1966–1974).
*Sir Marcus Worsley, 87, English politician, MP for Keighley (1959–1964) and Chelsea (1966–1974).Sir Marcus Worsley, Bt

response: William Ralph Worsley was born in York, the eldest son of Sir Marcus Worsley, 5th Baronet and Hon. Bridget Assheton, daughter of 1st Baron Clitheroe. His paternal aunt is Katharine, Duchess of Kent. He was educated at Harrow School and the Royal Agricultural College, following which he qualified as a Chartered Surveyor.

link_mentions.page: Wedding of Prince Edward, Duke of Kent, and Katharine Worsley
response: * William Worsley, son of Mr and Mrs Marcus Worsley, thus a nephew of the bride
** Mr and Mrs Marcus Worsley, the bride's brother and sister-in-law
